32static const std::array<std::array<bool, 7>, 7> POSITION_DETECTION_PATTERN = {
33 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1,
34 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1,
35 1, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0, 1,
36 1, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0, 1,
37 1, 0, 1, 1, 1, 0, 1,
38 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1,
39 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1,
40};
41
42static const std::array<std::array<bool, 5>, 5> POSITION_ADJUSTMENT_PATTERN = {
43 1, 1, 1, 1, 1,
44 1, 0, 0, 0, 1,
45 1, 0, 1, 0, 1,
46 1, 0, 0, 0, 1,
47 1, 1, 1, 1, 1,
48};
49
50// From Appendix E. Table 1, JIS0510X:2004 (p 71). The table was double-checked by komatsu.
51static const std::array<std::array<int16_t, 7>, 40> POSITION_ADJUSTMENT_PATTERN_COORDINATE_TABLE = {
52 -1, -1, -1, -1, -1, -1, -1, // Version 1
53 6, 18, -1, -1, -1, -1, -1, // Version 2
54 6, 22, -1, -1, -1, -1, -1, // Version 3
55 6, 26, -1, -1, -1, -1, -1, // Version 4
56 6, 30, -1, -1, -1, -1, -1, // Version 5
57 6, 34, -1, -1, -1, -1, -1, // Version 6
58 6, 22, 38, -1, -1, -1, -1, // Version 7
59 6, 24, 42, -1, -1, -1, -1, // Version 8
60 6, 26, 46, -1, -1, -1, -1, // Version 9
61 6, 28, 50, -1, -1, -1, -1, // Version 10
62 6, 30, 54, -1, -1, -1, -1, // Version 11
63 6, 32, 58, -1, -1, -1, -1, // Version 12
64 6, 34, 62, -1, -1, -1, -1, // Version 13
65 6, 26, 46, 66, -1, -1, -1, // Version 14
66 6, 26, 48, 70, -1, -1, -1, // Version 15
67 6, 26, 50, 74, -1, -1, -1, // Version 16
68 6, 30, 54, 78, -1, -1, -1, // Version 17
69 6, 30, 56, 82, -1, -1, -1, // Version 18
70 6, 30, 58, 86, -1, -1, -1, // Version 19
71 6, 34, 62, 90, -1, -1, -1, // Version 20
72 6, 28, 50, 72, 94, -1, -1, // Version 21
73 6, 26, 50, 74, 98, -1, -1, // Version 22
74 6, 30, 54, 78, 102, -1, -1, // Version 23
75 6, 28, 54, 80, 106, -1, -1, // Version 24
76 6, 32, 58, 84, 110, -1, -1, // Version 25
77 6, 30, 58, 86, 114, -1, -1, // Version 26
78 6, 34, 62, 90, 118, -1, -1, // Version 27
79 6, 26, 50, 74, 98, 122, -1, // Version 28
80 6, 30, 54, 78, 102, 126, -1, // Version 29
81 6, 26, 52, 78, 104, 130, -1, // Version 30
82 6, 30, 56, 82, 108, 134, -1, // Version 31
83 6, 34, 60, 86, 112, 138, -1, // Version 32
84 6, 30, 58, 86, 114, 142, -1, // Version 33
85 6, 34, 62, 90, 118, 146, -1, // Version 34
86 6, 30, 54, 78, 102, 126, 150, // Version 35
87 6, 24, 50, 76, 102, 128, 154, // Version 36
88 6, 28, 54, 80, 106, 132, 158, // Version 37
89 6, 32, 58, 84, 110, 136, 162, // Version 38
90 6, 26, 54, 82, 110, 138, 166, // Version 39
91 6, 30, 58, 86, 114, 142, 170, // Version 40
92};
93
94// Type info cells at the left top corner.
95static const std::array<std::array<int8_t, 2>, 15> TYPE_INFO_COORDINATES = {
96 8, 0,
97 8, 1,
98 8, 2,
99 8, 3,
100 8, 4,
101 8, 5,
102 8, 7,
103 8, 8,
104 7, 8,
105 5, 8,
106 4, 8,
107 3, 8,
108 2, 8,
109 1, 8,
110 0, 8,
111};
112
113// From Appendix D in JISX0510:2004 (p. 67)
114static const int VERSION_INFO_POLY = 0x1f25; // 1 1111 0010 0101
115
116 // From Appendix C in JISX0510:2004 (p.65).
117static const int TYPE_INFO_POLY = 0x537;
118static const int TYPE_INFO_MASK_PATTERN = 0x5412;
119
120static void EmbedTimingPatterns(TritMatrix& matrix)
121{
122 // -8 is for skipping position detection patterns (size 7), and two horizontal/vertical
123 // separation patterns (size 1). Thus, 8 = 7 + 1.
124 for (int i = 8; i < matrix.width() - 8; ++i) {
125 bool bit = (i + 1) % 2;
126 // Horizontal line.
127 matrix.set(i, 6, bit);
128 // Vertical line.
129 matrix.set(6, i, bit);
130 }
131}
132
133
134// Note that we cannot unify the function with embedPositionDetectionPattern() despite they are
135// almost identical, since we cannot write a function that takes 2D arrays in different sizes in
136// C/C++. We should live with the fact.
137static void EmbedPositionAdjustmentPattern(int xStart, int yStart, TritMatrix& matrix)
138{
139 for (int y = 0; y < 5; ++y) {
140 for (int x = 0; x < 5; ++x) {
141 matrix.set(xStart + x, yStart + y, POSITION_ADJUSTMENT_PATTERN[y][x]);
142 }
143 }
144}
145
146// Embed position adjustment patterns if need be.
147static void MaybeEmbedPositionAdjustmentPatterns(const Version& version, TritMatrix& matrix)
148{
149 if (version.versionNumber() < 2) { // The patterns appear if version >= 2
150 return;
151 }
152 int index = version.versionNumber() - 1;
153 auto& coordinates = POSITION_ADJUSTMENT_PATTERN_COORDINATE_TABLE[index];
154 int numCoordinates = Size(coordinates);
155 for (int i = 0; i < numCoordinates; ++i) {
156 for (int j = 0; j < numCoordinates; ++j) {
157 int y = coordinates[i];
158 int x = coordinates[j];
159 // Check x/y is valid: don't place alignment patterns intersecting with the 3 finder patterns
160 if (x == -1 || y == -1 || (x == 6 && y == 6) || (x == 6 && y == matrix.height() - 7)
161 || (x == matrix.width() - 7 && y == 6)) {
162 continue;
163 }
164 // -2 is necessary since the x/y coordinates point to the center of the pattern, not the
165 // left top corner.
166 EmbedPositionAdjustmentPattern(x - 2, y - 2, matrix);
167 }
168 }
169}
170
171static void EmbedPositionDetectionPattern(int xStart, int yStart, TritMatrix& matrix)
172{
173 for (int y = 0; y < 7; ++y) {
174 for (int x = 0; x < 7; ++x) {
175 matrix.set(xStart + x, yStart + y, POSITION_DETECTION_PATTERN[y][x]);
176 }
177 }
178
179 // Surround the 7x7 pattern with one line of white space (sepration pattern)
180 auto setIfInside = [&](int x, int y) {
181 if( x >= 0 && x < matrix.width() && y >= 0 && y < matrix.height())
182 matrix.set(x, y, 0);
183 };
184
185 for (int i = -1; i < 8; ++i) {
186 setIfInside(xStart + i, yStart - 1); // top
187 setIfInside(xStart + i, yStart + 7); // bottom
188 setIfInside(xStart - 1, yStart + i); // left
189 setIfInside(xStart + 7, yStart + i); // right
190 }
191}
192
193// Embed position detection patterns and surrounding vertical/horizontal separators.
194static void EmbedPositionDetectionPatternsAndSeparators(TritMatrix& matrix)
195{
196 // Embed three big squares at corners.
197 int pdpWidth = Size(POSITION_DETECTION_PATTERN[0]);
198 // Left top corner.
199 EmbedPositionDetectionPattern(0, 0, matrix);
200 // Right top corner.
201 EmbedPositionDetectionPattern(matrix.width() - pdpWidth, 0, matrix);
202 // Left bottom corner.
203 EmbedPositionDetectionPattern(0, matrix.width() - pdpWidth, matrix);
204}
205
206
207// Embed the lonely dark dot at left bottom corner. JISX0510:2004 (p.46)
208static void EmbedDarkDotAtLeftBottomCorner(TritMatrix& matrix)
209{
210 matrix.set(8, matrix.height() - 8, 1);
211}
212
213// Embed basic patterns. On success, modify the matrix and return true.
214// The basic patterns are:
215// - Position detection patterns
216// - Timing patterns
217// - Dark dot at the left bottom corner
218// - Position adjustment patterns, if need be
219static void EmbedBasicPatterns(const Version& version, TritMatrix& matrix)
220{
221 // Let's get started with embedding big squares at corners.
222 EmbedPositionDetectionPatternsAndSeparators(matrix);
223 // Then, embed the dark dot at the left bottom corner.
224 EmbedDarkDotAtLeftBottomCorner(matrix);
225
226 // Position adjustment patterns appear if version >= 2.
227 MaybeEmbedPositionAdjustmentPatterns(version, matrix);
228 // Timing patterns should be embedded after position adj. patterns.
229 EmbedTimingPatterns(matrix);
230}
231
232
233// Return the position of the most significant bit set (to one) in the "value". The most
234// significant bit is position 32. If there is no bit set, return 0. Examples:
235// - findMSBSet(0) => 0
236// - findMSBSet(1) => 1
237// - findMSBSet(255) => 8
238static int FindMSBSet(unsigned value)
239{
240 return 32 - BitHacks::NumberOfLeadingZeros(value);
241}
242
243// Calculate BCH (Bose-Chaudhuri-Hocquenghem) code for "value" using polynomial "poly". The BCH
244// code is used for encoding type information and version information.
245// Example: Calculation of version information of 7.
246// f(x) is created from 7.
247// - 7 = 000111 in 6 bits
248// - f(x) = x^2 + x^1 + x^0
249// g(x) is given by the standard (p. 67)
250// - g(x) = x^12 + x^11 + x^10 + x^9 + x^8 + x^5 + x^2 + 1
251// Multiply f(x) by x^(18 - 6)
252// - f'(x) = f(x) * x^(18 - 6)
253// - f'(x) = x^14 + x^13 + x^12
254// Calculate the remainder of f'(x) / g(x)
255// x^2
256// __________________________________________________
257// g(x) )x^14 + x^13 + x^12
258// x^14 + x^13 + x^12 + x^11 + x^10 + x^7 + x^4 + x^2
259// --------------------------------------------------
260// x^11 + x^10 + x^7 + x^4 + x^2
261//
262// The remainder is x^11 + x^10 + x^7 + x^4 + x^2
263// Encode it in binary: 110010010100
264// The return value is 0xc94 (1100 1001 0100)
265//
266// Since all coefficients in the polynomials are 1 or 0, we can do the calculation by bit
267// operations. We don't care if cofficients are positive or negative.
268static int CalculateBCHCode(int value, int poly) {
269 // If poly is "1 1111 0010 0101" (version info poly), msbSetInPoly is 13. We'll subtract 1
270 // from 13 to make it 12.
271 int msbSetInPoly = FindMSBSet(poly);
272 value <<= msbSetInPoly - 1;
273 // Do the division business using exclusive-or operations.
274 while (FindMSBSet(value) >= msbSetInPoly) {
275 value ^= poly << (FindMSBSet(value) - msbSetInPoly);
276 }
277 // Now the "value" is the remainder (i.e. the BCH code)
278 return value;
279}
280
281// Make bit vector of type information. On success, store the result in "bits" and return true.
282// Encode error correction level and mask pattern. See 8.9 of
283// JISX0510:2004 (p.45) for details.
284static void MakeTypeInfoBits(ErrorCorrectionLevel ecLevel, int maskPattern, BitArray& bits)
285{
286 if (maskPattern < 0 || maskPattern >= MatrixUtil::NUM_MASK_PATTERNS) {
287 throw std::invalid_argument("Invalid mask pattern");
288 }
289
290 int typeInfo = (BitsFromECLevel(ecLevel) << 3) | maskPattern;
291 bits.appendBits(typeInfo, 5);
292
293 int bchCode = CalculateBCHCode(typeInfo, TYPE_INFO_POLY);
294 bits.appendBits(bchCode, 10);
295
296 BitArray maskBits;
297 maskBits.appendBits(TYPE_INFO_MASK_PATTERN, 15);
298 bits.bitwiseXOR(maskBits);
299
300 if (bits.size() != 15) { // Just in case.
301 throw std::logic_error("Should not happen but we got: " + std::to_string(bits.size()));
302 }
303}
304
305// Embed type information. On success, modify the matrix.
306static void EmbedTypeInfo(ErrorCorrectionLevel ecLevel, int maskPattern, TritMatrix& matrix)
307{
308 BitArray typeInfoBits;
309 MakeTypeInfoBits(ecLevel, maskPattern, typeInfoBits);
310
311 for (int i = 0; i < typeInfoBits.size(); ++i) {
312 // Place bits in LSB to MSB order. LSB (least significant bit) is the last value in
313 // "typeInfoBits".
314 bool bit = typeInfoBits.get(typeInfoBits.size() - 1 - i);
315
316 // Type info bits at the left top corner. See 8.9 of JISX0510:2004 (p.46).
317 int x1 = TYPE_INFO_COORDINATES[i][0];
318 int y1 = TYPE_INFO_COORDINATES[i][1];
319 matrix.set(x1, y1, bit);
320
321 if (i < 8) {
322 // Right top corner.
323 int x2 = matrix.width() - i - 1;
324 int y2 = 8;
325 matrix.set(x2, y2, bit);
326 }
327 else {
328 // Left bottom corner.
329 int x2 = 8;
330 int y2 = matrix.height() - 7 + (i - 8);
331 matrix.set(x2, y2, bit);
332 }
333 }
334}
335
336// Make bit vector of version information. On success, store the result in "bits" and return true.
337// See 8.10 of JISX0510:2004 (p.45) for details.
338static void MakeVersionInfoBits(const Version& version, BitArray& bits)
339{
340 bits.appendBits(version.versionNumber(), 6);
341 int bchCode = CalculateBCHCode(version.versionNumber(), VERSION_INFO_POLY);
342 bits.appendBits(bchCode, 12);
343
344 if (bits.size() != 18) { // Just in case.
345 throw std::logic_error("Should not happen but we got: " + std::to_string(bits.size()));
346 }
347}
348
349// Embed version information if need be. On success, modify the matrix and return true.
350// See 8.10 of JISX0510:2004 (p.47) for how to embed version information.
351static void MaybeEmbedVersionInfo(const Version& version, TritMatrix& matrix)
352{
353 if (version.versionNumber() < 7) { // Version info is necessary if version >= 7.
354 return; // Don't need version info.
355 }
356
357 BitArray versionInfoBits;
358 MakeVersionInfoBits(version, versionInfoBits);
359
360 int bitIndex = 6 * 3 - 1; // It will decrease from 17 to 0.
361 for (int i = 0; i < 6; ++i) {
362 for (int j = 0; j < 3; ++j) {
363 // Place bits in LSB (least significant bit) to MSB order.
364 bool bit = versionInfoBits.get(bitIndex);
365 bitIndex--;
366 // Left bottom corner.
367 matrix.set(i, matrix.height() - 11 + j, bit);
368 // Right bottom corner.
369 matrix.set(matrix.height() - 11 + j, i, bit);
370 }
371 }
372}
373
374/**
375* Return the mask bit for "getMaskPattern" at "x" and "y". See 8.8 of JISX0510:2004 for mask
376* pattern conditions.
377*/
378static bool GetDataMaskBit(int maskPattern, int x, int y)
379{
380 int intermediate;
381 int temp;
382 switch (maskPattern) {
383 case 0:
384 intermediate = (y + x) & 0x1;
385 break;
386 case 1:
387 intermediate = y & 0x1;
388 break;
389 case 2:
390 intermediate = x % 3;
391 break;
392 case 3:
393 intermediate = (y + x) % 3;
394 break;
395 case 4:
396 intermediate = ((y / 2) + (x / 3)) & 0x1;
397 break;
398 case 5:
399 temp = y * x;
400 intermediate = (temp & 0x1) + (temp % 3);
401 break;
402 case 6:
403 temp = y * x;
404 intermediate = ((temp & 0x1) + (temp % 3)) & 0x1;
405 break;
406 case 7:
407 temp = y * x;
408 intermediate = ((temp % 3) + ((y + x) & 0x1)) & 0x1;
409 break;
410 default:
411 throw std::invalid_argument("Invalid mask pattern: " + std::to_string(maskPattern));
412 }
413 return intermediate == 0;
414}
415
416// Embed "dataBits" using "getMaskPattern". On success, modify the matrix and return true.
417// For debugging purposes, it skips masking process if "getMaskPattern" is -1.
418// See 8.7 of JISX0510:2004 (p.38) for how to embed data bits.
419static void EmbedDataBits(const BitArray& dataBits, int maskPattern, TritMatrix& matrix)
420{
421 int bitIndex = 0;
422 int direction = -1;
423 // Start from the right bottom cell.
424 int x = matrix.width() - 1;
425 int y = matrix.height() - 1;
426 while (x > 0) {
427 // Skip the vertical timing pattern.
428 if (x == 6) {
429 x -= 1;
430 }
431 while (y >= 0 && y < matrix.height()) {
432 for (int xx = x; xx > x - 2; --xx) {
433 // Skip the cell if it's not empty.
434 if (!matrix.get(xx, y).isEmpty()) {
435 continue;
436 }
437 // Padding bit. If there is no bit left, we'll fill the left cells with 0, as described
438 // in 8.4.9 of JISX0510:2004 (p. 24).
439 bool bit = bitIndex < dataBits.size() ? dataBits.get(bitIndex) : false;
440 ++bitIndex;
441
442 // Skip masking if mask_pattern is -1.
443 if (maskPattern != -1 && GetDataMaskBit(maskPattern, xx, y)) {
444 bit = !bit;
445 }
446 matrix.set(xx, y, bit);
447 }
448 y += direction;
449 }
450 direction = -direction; // Reverse the direction.
451 y += direction;
452 x -= 2; // Move to the left.
453 }
454 // All bits should be consumed.
455 if (bitIndex < dataBits.size()) {
456 throw std::invalid_argument("Not all bits consumed: " + std::to_string(bitIndex) + '/' + std::to_string(dataBits.size()));
457 }
458}
459
460// Build 2D matrix of QR Code from "dataBits" with "ecLevel", "version" and "getMaskPattern". On
461// success, store the result in "matrix" and return true.
462void
463MatrixUtil::BuildMatrix(const BitArray& dataBits, ErrorCorrectionLevel ecLevel, const Version& version, int maskPattern, TritMatrix& matrix)
464{
465 matrix.clear();
466 EmbedBasicPatterns(version, matrix);
467 // Type information appear with any version.
468 EmbedTypeInfo(ecLevel, maskPattern, matrix);
469 // Version info appear if version >= 7.
470 MaybeEmbedVersionInfo(version, matrix);
471 // Data should be embedded at end.
472 EmbedDataBits(dataBits, maskPattern, matrix);
473}
474
475} // QRCode
476} // ZXing
